Italy: The Belice earthquake sequence took place in Sicily between 14 and 15 January. The largest shock measured 5.5 on the moment magnitude scale, with five others of magnitude 5+. The maximum perceived intensity was X (Extreme) on the Mercalli intensity scale. The earthquake sequence, centred between the towns of Gibellina, Salaparuta and Poggioreale, killed at least 231 people, possibly more than 400, with between 632 and about 1,000 injured and left 100,000 homeless. It is known in Italy as Terremoto del Belice.
The University of Trento is occupied by students.
The Italian national football team wins its first UEFA European Championship at Rome, against Yugoslavia.
Giovanni Leone was appointed First Minister: remains in office until December.
In Sicily clashes between strikers and police.
Mariano Rumor reconstitutes a center-left government.
